snippet: A United Nations official condemned Iran’s vice president for a speech at an anti-drug conference in Iran in which he blamed the Talmud, a central text of Judaism, for promoting drug addiction.
abstract: Anti-Semitic speech by Iranian Vice Pres Mohammad-Reza Rahimi draws sharp criticism from Yury Fedotov, leader of a United Nations agency who helped convene a conference in Iran aimed at stopping the flow of illegal drugs; Rahimi's speech blamed the Talmud, a central text of Judaism, for promoting drug addiction.
lead_paragraph: A United Nations official condemned Iran’s vice president for a speech at an anti-drug conference in Iran in which he blamed the Talmud, a central text of Judaism, for promoting drug addiction.

headline.main: Iran: U.N. and U.S. Condemn an Anti-Semitic Speech
